summary: Email correspondence between defense attorneys and the US Attorney's Office regarding discovery requests in the case of Nicholas Tartaglione, focusing on the July 22-23, 2019 incident involving Jeffrey Epstein's death in the MCC SHU. The prosecution provides responses to requests for video, photos, reports, and interviews related to the incident.

persons.name: Bruce Barket
persons.context: Attorney representing Nicholas Tartaglione, making discovery requests regarding the July 22-23 incident involving Jeffrey Epstein at MCC.

persons.name: Aida Leisenring
persons.context: Attorney working with Bruce Barket on the Tartaglione case, mentioned as planning to review materials regarding the Epstein incident.

persons.name: Tony Ricco
persons.context: Attorney copied on the discovery request correspondence regarding the Tartaglione/Epstein incident.

persons.name: John Diaz
persons.context: Attorney from the US Attorney's Office responding to discovery requests about the Epstein investigation and Tartaglione case.

persons.name: Bruce Koffsky
persons.context: Attorney copied on the discovery request correspondence regarding the Tartaglione/Epstein incident.

persons.name: Nicholas Tartaglione
persons.context: Inmate who was housed in the same SHU cell as Jeffrey Epstein on July 22-23, 2019, and subject of discovery requests regarding the incident.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Deceased inmate who was found dead in his MCC cell on July 23, 2019, while housed with Nicholas Tartaglione.

connections.description: Barket is representing Tartaglione in legal proceedings and making discovery requests on his behalf.
Both are defense attorneys working together on the Tartaglione case, planning to review discovery materials.
Were housed together in the same SHU cell at MCC on July 22-23, 2019, when Epstein was found dead.
Diaz (prosecution) is responding to discovery requests from Barket (defense) regarding the Epstein/Tartaglione incident.

events.title: Epstein-Tartaglione Cell Incident
events.description: Incident involving Jeffrey Epstein and Nicholas Tartaglione in their shared SHU cell at MCC, resulting in Epstein's death.

events.title: Discovery Request Correspondence
events.description: Email exchange between defense attorneys and US Attorney's Office regarding discovery materials related to the Epstein/Tartaglione incident.

events.title: Scheduled Conference
events.description: Upcoming conference mentioned where the BOP investigative report could be reviewed in advance.

locations: United States Attorney's Office, Southern District of New York, One Saint Andrew's Plaza, New York, NY 10007
Barket, Epstein, Kearon, Aldea & LoTurco, 666 Old Country Road, Garden City, NY 11530
keyFacts: No video surveillance exists of the area outside the cells for the night of July 22-23, 2019, according to BOP.
No documentation exists regarding the decision to house Tartaglione and Epstein together in the same SHU cell.
No After Action Report was prepared by BOP for the July 22/23 incident involving Epstein's death.
The BOP investigative report related to the incident is 53 pages and designated Attorney's Eyes Only.
The defense requested photographs of the Tartaglione/Epstein cell after the incident and photos of both individuals following the incident.
